channel.title: Comments on: Tiramisu – Daring Bakers Challenge February 2010

item.title: By: buna
item.dc:creator: buna
item.description: Leave place for dessert? After going through your blog and recipes i would want to have only dessert!! Amazing desserts and so well demonstrated with pictures. thank you for sharing especially the cheese making . and the sponge fingers love it all!!
item.content:encoded: Leave place for dessert? After going through your blog and recipes i would want to have only dessert!! Amazing desserts and so well demonstrated with pictures. thank you for sharing especially the cheese making . and the sponge fingers love it all!!

item.title: By: Fiona
item.dc:creator: Fiona
item.description:
This dessert looks wonderful - like the others, I love the cone shape, and I will steal this idea for the future.
Years before Tiramisu became a household word, I used to make a Marsala Log, which basically operated on the same principle but with different flavours. You dipped Choc Ripple bikkies in marsala then stood them up sandwiched with choc cream. Then I discovered you could make the log with gingernut biscuits, and preserved ginger through the cream.
My point is, there is a sort of basic style of dessert which involves dipping some kind of biscuit/cake into some kind of liquid and layering (either vertically or horizontally) with some kind of flavoured cream. And that means there are endless possibilities, and therefore no condemnation of choosing not to have coffee!
item.content:encoded:
This dessert looks wonderful – like the others, I love the cone shape, and I will steal this idea for the future.

Years before Tiramisu became a household word, I used to make a Marsala Log, which basically operated on the same principle but with different flavours. You dipped Choc Ripple bikkies in marsala then stood them up sandwiched with choc cream. Then I discovered you could make the log with gingernut biscuits, and preserved ginger through the cream.

My point is, there is a sort of basic style of dessert which involves dipping some kind of biscuit/cake into some kind of liquid and layering (either vertically or horizontally) with some kind of flavoured cream. And that means there are endless possibilities, and therefore no condemnation of choosing not to have coffee!

item.title: By: Julie
item.dc:creator: Julie
item.description:
I have made varied versions of tiramisu ... love the full coffee/rum version but a great alternative is rasperberry and limecello, with a white chocolate pastry cream. have to say its always a winner.
Thanks for the marscapone recipe - am off to try this in the weekend!
item.content:encoded:
I have made varied versions of tiramisu … love the full coffee/rum version but a great alternative is rasperberry and limecello, with a white chocolate pastry cream. have to say its always a winner.

Thanks for the marscapone recipe – am off to try this in the weekend!

item.title: By: Stephanie
item.dc:creator: Stephanie
item.description: Amazing! Thank you for sharing - especially the part of making my own cheese. I had no idea how to do this!!
item.content:encoded: Amazing! Thank you for sharing – especially the part of making my own cheese. I had no idea how to do this!!

item.title: By: Trisha
item.dc:creator: Trisha
item.description: Oh my goodness! Tiramisu is one of my most favourite desserts and this is just so generously beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!
item.content:encoded: Oh my goodness! Tiramisu is one of my most favourite desserts and this is just so generously beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!

item.title: By: bake in paris
item.dc:creator: bake in paris
item.description:
I love the cone shaped tiramisu. It is very inventive :-) I once thought about having the dome tiramisu, but it was just too complicated to start with ...
Sawadee from bangkok, Kris
item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: Y
item.dc:creator: Y
item.description: Especially love that cone shaped tiramisu. It somehow looks really Christmassy to me. Yummy!
item.content:encoded: Especially love that cone shaped tiramisu. It somehow looks really Christmassy to me. Yummy!

item.title: By: Devaki @ weavethousandflavors
item.dc:creator: Devaki @ weavethousandflavors
item.description:
Dear Anita - I love the way you are carrying your conical shaped theme from the previous post into traditional (and not so traditional) tiramisu.
Coffee & chocolate! Mocha anyone? :)
Lovely post. Always a pleasure to visit.
Ciao,
Devaki @ weavethousandflavors
item.content:encoded:
Dear Anita – I love the way you are carrying your conical shaped theme from the previous post into traditional (and not so traditional) tiramisu.

Coffee & chocolate! Mocha anyone? ðŸ™‚

Lovely post. Always a pleasure to visit.

Ciao,

Devaki @ weavethousandflavors

item.title: By: Sweets By Vicky
item.dc:creator: Sweets By Vicky
item.description: Love all the shots of the baking process! It's as if you're right there guiding me! And the thick, fudgey chocolate got me desperate for some tiramisu!
item.content:encoded: Love all the shots of the baking process! It’s as if you’re right there guiding me! And the thick, fudgey chocolate got me desperate for some tiramisu!
